text: One of the original Dark Lords of Nagash, the Dread King was a mighty undead Liche of Nehekhara. A powerful warrior and practitioner of necromancy, he would become one of the most feared and mysterious beings to have ever existed
The Black Grail Knights were the resurrected corpses of twelve long dead Grail Knights of Bretonnia. They were among the mightiest Undead to have ever walked the Old World.

Undoubtedly the cruellest ruler ever in Araby, Jaffar controlled the land for many years during the Crusades. Jaffar was a powerful sorcerer who in 1435 IC united Araby and ruled it as Sultan for fifteen years.

This fiery Djinn has succumbed to the addiction of the winds of fire. All restraints and composure are gone replaced with a desire to see flesh and bone succumb to the glorious flame that now enslaves it.
The Sheikhs are wise and powerful warriors, they bring great honour to Araby and are rightly rewarded though some struggle with the excess this life brings.
The Sheikhs are wise and powerful warriors, they bring great honour to Araby and are rightly rewarded though some struggle with the excess this life brings.
Be'lakor, Chaos Daemon Prince, has known many different names. He is a creature who wields unholy weapons and abilities, and a figure who once commanded legions of unnatural beings.
Nobles prefer to ride into battle. They are better equipped and trained than the ordinary warrior.
A warrior who undergoes a secret ritual, voluntarily leaving his mortal body behind to inhabit a shell of plant and earth is forever becoming a Viridian Lord, a chosen of Danu.

Fenbeasts are magical constructs, made of the foul mud and rotting wood of Albion. They are powered by the shard of an Ogham Stone within their body and said to be animated by the souls of those who died in the swamps.
Queen
For the fierce barbarians of Albion, war is an integral part of life. Every able man knows how to fight and will defend his homeland in times of peril.

Youngbloods are apprentice warriors, too inexperienced to be part of a regular warband. They hurl javelins at their opponents to gain battle experience and will avoid the danger of melee as well as they can.
In battle, Woad Raiders fight with wild abandon, putting all their trust into the protection granted by the magical patterns covering their body.
Dogs serve as companions for hunters and shepherds in peace times. In war, they are starved and then released in packs on vulnerable targets.

Druid Neophytes are magically gifted apprentices, following the path of the Truthsayers. They are sent out in a battle to provide support for their fellow clansmen and learn to wield their magic in battle.
Stonethrowers are a result of contact between the natives of Albion and outside forces. They are rather poorly constructed, but sufficient for the task they are meant to perform.

The legendary giants of Albion were the last gift of the Old Ones to the inhabitants of Albion. Like all giants, they are but a shadow of their ancestors' glory, however, they haven't fallen as low as their kin outside of Albion... yet.
Huntresses perform a dual role for the tribes of Albion, providing both food and ranged support in times of need.
Only wealthier warriors can afford horses in Albion. This fact makes these warriors often insufferably arrogant. Nevertheless, they are excellent light cavalry.
Hearthguard are the military aristocracy of Albion. They are professional warriors, forming the hard core of Albion armies and serve as bodyguards for chieftains and warlords.
Chariots are popular among the Albion warrior nobility and chariot races are a popular pass time on the plains.
The first Truthsayers were pupils of the Old Ones themselves. Much of the knowledge they were taught has been lost over the ages though, but even so, Truthsayers still wield strong magical powers.
Centaurs roam the plains of Albion. They are proud and independent, but in times of peril they will join forces with the clans.
A Fenhulk is a gargantuan variant of the fenbeast. A whole Ogham Stone is needed to animate this terrifying construct, which is one of the reasons why Truthsayers rarely summon one.

Warleaders are the strongest and fiercest warriors of Albion. They usually have command over the warbands of several tribes and clans and will be called upon whenever the people of Albion have to wage war on a larger scale.
A Chieftan is a mighty warrior who gained leadership of a whole clan or tribe. In war, they serve as officers of a Warleader. New Warleaders usually emerge from the ranks of the mightiest Chieftains.

No one knows the exact origin of the mysterious woman called Morrigan. Most inhabitants of Albion believe that she is a goddess of death and war who will sometimes aid her people when they are in great danger.
It is unknown whether or not Half-Giants really bear the blood of Giants as they claim, but their strength makes them a welcome addition to each Albion warband either way.

Wyrd Druids have walked the Path of the Truthsayers, but either failed or left this path on their own. Despite only being able to cast simpler spells, they are still highly valued and often employed by chieftains as their personal advisors.

Wyrd Druids have walked the Path of the Truthsayers, but either failed or left this path on their own. Despite only being able to cast simpler spells, they are still highly valued and often employed by chieftains as their personal advisors.
It is traditional in Albion's society for females to hold honorary warrior positions and they are as fierce and respected as their male counterparts.

No one knows the exact origin of the mysterious woman called Morrigan. Most inhabitants of Albion believe that she is a goddess of death and war who will sometimes aid her people when they are in great danger.

The people of the Highlands of Albion are reclusive and fiercely independent from the other tribes of Albion. Their skills and will have been honed by their harsh homeland and their mighty warriors are a welcome addition to any army.
Mighty kings and warriors of Albion who left this mortal plain long ago still rise up in defense of their sacred resting place and homeland.
Sworn to protect the Oracle with their lives, the Maidenguard are highly capable defenders.
Bologs is the mightiest Giant of Albion - at least in terms of sheer strength. He is not very intelligent though, his name being the only means of communication and is also used as his battlecry.
The Fly-Infested Rotwood is a group of legendary Fenbeasts, risen from an especially corrupted, polluted swamp by a Truthsayer of old - a feat never accomplished before or after.

The Bloodsworn are warriors who have dishonored themselves. To regain their honor, they serve amongst the Bloodsworn, frenzied warriors who will never retreat. Should they survive 5 years of service, their crimes will be forgiven and they may return to their old lifes.

Leadership of the tribes is not hereditary - the chieftains firstborn son can very well be refused as a successor. Those who won't accept this often band together to seek glory on the battlefield and to prove that they are worthy after all.
This holy warband is devoted to Lugh, the god of the sun. Their weapons are imbued with the fire of the sun and they themselves fear no fire as they believe in Lugh's protection.

The Wardens of the Bloodswamp are an order of female warriors who keep watch over the Bloodswamp, a cursed bog where many battles have been fought. They prevent monsters from leaving the area, be it Fimir or other horrors spawned by the twisted swamp.
The Hunters of the Great Plains hunt those monsters who dare threatening the peace of the home of their nomadic people, weakening them from afar before slaying them in melee.
Cachtorr is smaller and weaker than his brother, Bologs. However he is much smarter, showing a glimpse of the intelligence of giants of old.
The Defenders of Carn Mallog are renowned for their skill and tenacity.

These warriors are highly experienced and proficient fighters led by Sergeant Gunther Schepke, Bernhardt's second in command. As part of the respected mercenary army known as the Grudgebringers they are completely loyal to their Commander.
This machine fires heavy cannonballs which can tear through enemy regiments and light buildings with ease.

Taking their name from their Commander's powerful sword 'Grudgebringer' these mercenaries form the core of the army known as the Grudgebringers. They are skilled in combat and ride into battle on mighty warhorses.
As part of the respected Grudgebringer mercenary army, these troops are skilled in their art and loyal to their Commander.

Helmgart Keep is the home of Franz Erikson who leads a regiment of bowmen. These 'Helmgart Bowmen', while not the best of their kind, had served with honour and even took part in saving the Emperor's cousin, Countess Isabell, from a bandit ambush.
Johann Keeler's longbows have gained a reputation throughout Averland as skilled archers, competing in many provincial tournaments. They also hold field experience from previous mercenary campaigns.
On the orders of King Ungrunn Dragonbane, envoy Engrol Goldtongue with a small army of well-known regiments was sent to help the allied Empire.
On the orders of King Ungrunn Dragonbane, envoy Engrol Goldtongue with a small army of well-known regiments was sent to help the allied Empire.

These massive creatures stand twice as tall as a man and are far more strongly built. Although they are not particularly intelligent, they are strong and tough and fight ferociously. Ogres provoke fear.
These tall, agile warriors are armed with powerful longbows. They are quick on their feet, are not slowed by difficult terrain and are equally as good hand-to-hand fighters as other Elves.
These extremely large creatures are incredibly strong and tough. However, their dry woody skin suffers great damage if burned, so fire is their greatest enemy. Treemen provoke fear.

Ramon Black formed the Avengers after a Skaven raiding party burned their homes and killed their families during an attack on their town of Wissenheim. They are sworn to hunt down and kill Skaven wherever they can find them.

These warriors form part of the militia commanded by the Border Prince and former mercenary Sven Carlsson, a personal friend of Bernhardt. They ride into battle on mighty warhorses and are proficient in combat.
These warriors form part of the militia commanded by the Border Prince and former mercenary Sven Carlsson, a personal friend of Bernhardt. They are proficient in combat.

Charged with the protection of Emperor Karl Franz' cousin Countess Isabel. Led by Captain Heinz Klemper, these halberdiers, like all the Empire's heavy infantrymen, are highly trained and proficient melee fighters.

Siegfried Vannheim is a well renowned mercenary captain and has worked all through the Old World and beyond during his years leading the '75th. Reputably a staunch disciplinarian, Vannheim is followed by his cavalry troops with faithful loyalty and a respect for his veteran experience in the trade
These extremely large creatures are incredibly strong and tough. However, their dry woody skin suffers great damage if burned, so fire is their greatest enemy. Treemen provoke fear.

A lone Elven Ranger of the Black Mountains, Ceridan is a descendant of the ancient elves who created the Menhir and like the past generations of his family, his eternal quest is to protect the Standing Stones.

These warriors originate from the cold and inhospitable lands of Norsca where they fight under the command of Eric Ragnar, their leader and a personal friend of Bernhardt. They ride into battle on mighty warhorses and are skilled in combat.
Armour is useless against hits from a cannon. Its enormously long range is only equalled by chaos artillery
Determined and confident, Dwarfs are immensely strong and resilient although slow on their feet
Flagellants' madness gives them superhuman strength and resilience and they fight with outstanding fury
Halberdiers, like all the Empire's infantry, are highly trained and proficient fighters
Having sipped from the grail itself, these Knights are the most powerful of all the Knights of Bretonnia
Helmgart bowmen are armed with standard bows which have a medium range
Taking their name from their Commander's powerful sword 'Grudgebringer' these mercenaries form the core of the army known as the Grudgebringers
These highly trained warriors were once swordsmen of the Empire, but abandoned it to fight outside the law for greater material gain
These Knights belong to the most numerous of the Bretonnian orders of chivalry
These tall, agile warriors are armed with powerful longbows. Their skill as archers is excellent and their bows have a very long range
These tall, agile warriors live in the forests of Loren. They are quick on their feet, are not slowed by difficult terrain and are skilled in combat
These troops are armed with powerful crossbows, which have a long range but require line of sight to their target
These warriors are highly experienced and proficient fighters led by Sergeant Gunther Schepke, Bernhardt's second in command
These warriors form part of the militia commanded by the Border Prince and former mercenary Sven Carlsson
These warriors originate from the cold and inhospitable lands of Norsca where they fight under the command of Eric Ragnar
These warriors wield so large swords, that they must be swung with both hands and therefore strike with great force
These young mercenaries are fairly inexperienced, but make an exceptional rapid response force
This machine fires explosive shells high into the air, sending them crashing into enemy ranks
This machine fires heavy cannonballs which can tear through enemy regiments and light buildings with ease, but is progressively more inaccurate the further it fires
Ice Magic is a native form of Magic practised in the northern regions of Kislev. An Ice Mage is able to control magical energy to produce deadly spells of ice and cold
The very few capable of wielding magic are trained at Altdorf's Colleges of Magic, on their return they lead their people to war.
Resourceful, brave and skilled with a bow these rangers are often commended by their superiors who look the other way when the Halflings inevitably find themselves in trouble with the quartermasters.
Halflings hail from the Moot and though not a warring race can be a plucky foe in times of need often forming militias in defence of their homes.
Extraordinary trackers and excellent marksmen, this famous band of Halfling mercenaries have fought and won many battles under Lumpins leadership and have acquired a well-deserved reputation.

Glibfoot's Damned has defended the Moot since its inception and encompass veterans of many battles and adventures including the infamous Battle of 100 Cannons this has led to them been revered throughout the Moot.
The brutish ogres are a powerful ally to have on the battlefield, that is until they flee at the first sign of trouble.
A gift to the Halflings from the Elector Count of Averland. The Mootland folk have since made the steam tank more "homely" with the addition of a soup cannon.
Respected and professional warriors, they patrol the Moot vanquishing evil and keeping the citizens of the land safe.

The promise of spiced mutton stew and other homely fare pushes the troops to protect their cooks. Though the cooks should not be underestimated, anyone who spends that much time with a cleaver knows how to wield it.
While "borrowing" is a normal Halfling custom there are limits, as these poor fools have found out, forced into military service until their debt is repaid.
Hailing from the Darklands, these ogres freed their Halfling captives and escorted them back to the Moot, where they now serve as guardians and are well-fed in return.
There is no greater honour in the Moot than to be a cook at the Grand Cauldron.

The Halflings have developed a crude catapult that hurls vats of boiling slosh into the enemy ranks, many though do not like this technological advance and only one regiment has ever been commissioned until tempers simmer down.
Skattach is one of the most powerful living Mearghs - the witch-queens of the FImir - which has lead hear to claim the mantle of Hellmother, ruler of all Fimir Clans.
Prince Althran is determined to uphold the ‘Stormrider’ name and will stop at nothing to protect his people and the domains of Ulthuan in glory and bloodshed.
Prince Althran is determined to uphold the ‘Stormrider’ name and will stop at nothing to protect his people and the domains of Ulthuan in glory and bloodshed.
Fimm Warriors riding to war on the back of Bog Beasts, daemonic servant creatures from the dark depths of the swamps.

Some Arabyans are so adept at camel riding that they kick their training up a notch and carry jezzails to battle. Now, that's a sight to remember - if you're not on the other side of their dreadful aim.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
Trained from birth to ride these sturdy beasts, most camel riders can be traced to beduin origin. They know how to tame it, and best of all, they know how to bond with it.
Some say the giant cockerel originated by being cross-bred with a Lustrian Culchan but whatever the truth these birds are bred for war.
A herd of frenzied pigs on the battlefield sounds amusing until they have you in their sights.
Halfing bows are used for hunting and sports, but in times of peril, the defenders of the Moot can't be picky.
Even if it is just a halfling swinging it, a hammer will crush bones.
A pitchfork may not be made for war, but that is of no comfort to those on the receiving end.
It takes a certain kind of cruelty to snatch a babe from its mother only to send it to war before it is ready.
The best way to motivate halflings to fight is to bring their food to the front lines. That way they have to stay and defend it.

An itinerant wanderer, the Grey Wizard Olorin is much admired in the Moot for his fireworks displays and even more so for his ability to pull rabbits out of a hat. Tasty rabbits, too. Olorin has a secret, but he's not telling.
Aragand the Layabout is the type of bloke you see sitting in the corner of every tavern in the Empire. Alone, scruffy and unloved. He claims to be a King in waiting of a far off land.
Aragand the Layabout is in fact the true ruler of a petty kingdom in the Borderlands! Overthrown and exiled by an ambitious and cruel family member, he has been wandering the world ever since.
Legles, out for his morning constitutional, was forcibly befriended by a hapless Dwarf, named Giblit. The two have formed an unlikely friendship.
Giblit is a failed Slayer. In absolute shame, his peers sent him out to befriend an Elf. This he did, much to the Elf's disgust.
Magic is the stuff of Chaos itself, and those who wield it without safeguard are destined to warp, body and soul, beneath its baleful power.
The sorcerers of Araby have perfected the art of binding aerial spirits into physical forms - not least of which is the famous Flying Carpets.
The naffatun of Saghash are renown for their chemical insight. Whether shot on the tips of arrows, or thrown in clay pots, there is no escaping the wet fire.
The Genies of Araby have mastery over the four native elements: water, sand, fire, and air.
Water Djinns that dwell along the coasts of Araby are fearsome indeed.
Sand Djinns that live in the deserts of Araby are a force to reckoned with.
Fire Djinns thrive under the hot sun of Araby and are powerful allies... and enemies.
Air Djinns are native to the skies of Araby and are an excellent choice when it comes to enchanting furniture.
The Magicians of Araby who dwell near the sea are adept at manipulating the Wind of Ghyran and taming Sea Nymphs.
The Magicians of the desert have their own magical tradition and can manipulate many of the Winds of Magic.
Some Arabyan Magicians have mastered a technique to control Fire Efreets, and have learned to control the Wind of Aqshy along the way.
Tempest Djinns and the Wind of Azyr are the powerful allies of these Arabyan Magicians.
The Grand Bombard is made for one purpose only, the utter destruction of enemy defences.
A gift to the Halflings from the Elector Count of Averland. The Mootland folk have since made the steam tank more "homely" with the addition of a soup cannon.
A pot of boiling liquid hurled at the enemy's ranks, burning, scalding and even dissolving the foe.
There is no better Hot-Pot Catapult crew than those who serve at the Grand Cauldron.
Despite having no depth perception, the Fimir are pretty good at throwing javelins at enemies.
The sorcerers of Araby have perfected the art of binding aerial spirits into physical forms - not least of which is the famous Flying Carpets.
These fearsome beasts can trample men and horse alike into the dust.
These fearsome beasts can trample men and horse alike into the dust.
Every Fimir clan has a small cabal of apprentice Balefiends that serves directly under the tutelage of the Meargh.
The largest and fiercest scorpions in all the world, they require a rider who wears magical robes of protection that can cut through the sand.
Through foul necromancy, the skeletal remains of long-dead giants are brought back to a shambling unlife.
Screaming halflings on top of pigs. May look queer but enemies get stabbed in addition to being trampled.

The legendary giants of Albion were the last gift of the Old Ones to the inhabitants of Albion. Like all giants, they are but a shadow of their ancestors' glory, but they haven't fallen as low as their kin outside of Albion. At least for now.
These trolls are more than willing to throw their enemies a bone or two.
An effective siege engine capable of lobbing large wall... or creature crushing boulders.
These Lesser Daemons are deadly warriors believed to have been foremost amongst the Blood God's followers in mortal life and whose will is as implacable and blood-hungry as that of Khorne himself.
Ferocious female hunters said to prowl the deep southern jungles.

Feral Gryphons are known to dwell on Albion and often clash with the giants for food and living space. In times of need the Truthsayers can use their close magical connection to call upon these creatures in times of war.
Mightiest and wisest of the Truthsayers, Dural Durak leads Albion's ranks in times of peace and war.
A distinguished soldier in life, the Dread Legion Centurion now serves as an officer of the Dread King in death.
Lured by promises of eternal unlife and power, Gunther Larenscheld has awoken the Dread King from his slumber and sworn loyalty to Nagash's cause.
A Chuckwagon makes some of its army's most important tactical decisions, including what to have for breakfast, when to have supper, and what amount of smokeleaf should be handed out to the troops.
Liches are mighty necromancers who achieved immortality through undeath. This is an honour bestowed only on the most loyal and talented followers of Nagash.
Loyal in life and even more so in death, these mighty undead protected the tomb of the Dread King while he was waiting for his resurrection. Now they form the elite core of his infantry.
Using secret knowledge of the Mortuary Cult, the servants of Nagash can create mighty undead by mummification. They are slow but resilient and mighty warriors who must not be underestimated.

Wandering goblins can sometimes be found trailing Troll tribes in hope of picking clean any discarded carcasses. Ugma pressed these gobbos into service and they make for good scouts and archers keeping scavengers away.

The Goblins of the Carrion Tribe are largely ignored by the Trolls as long as they find enough food, something the squig hoppers have no difficulty in.  At any rate it's a much better deal than you'd get under an orc.
The number of goblins under Ugma's service grew so large he ordained them as the Carrion Tribe, with a new sense of belonging these outcasts gladly make up the chaff for Ugma's armies

These terrifying creatures are similar in appearance to their kin the Stone Trolls but of a much darker complexion. They are attributed in myth to utter a deep guttural sound, akin to mocking laughter before they tear their prey to pieces."

One of the original Dark Lords and once one of Nagash's favourite servants, the powerful Liche only known as the Hand of Nagash has fallen out of favour after repeated failures. He will do everything to regain the good will of his eternal master.
In Araby, magic users are respected and invaluable councillors to Caliphs and Sultans, so naturally most end up in the illustrious position of Grand Vizier.
Returning to her native people after being ousted from the Border Princes, Prince Fatandira is equal parts a military commander and an enlightened ruler.
The self-styled "Sultan of the Seas", the eccentric Golden Magus hides incredible sorcerous powers beneath his gaudy appearance.

One of the 3 Royal Djinn, the famed elemental kings. The Great Sultan of Flame is a great being shaped like a fire column, armed with scimitars of flame and emitting mortal heat, like that of the caldera of a volcano.
Glibfoot is the greatest Halfling hero Mootland, or indeed, the entire world, has seen for generations... if you believe half his tales.
Halfling commanders lead with hope in one hand and the promise of food in the other. It is surprisingly effective.
Esteemed figures in Halfling society, Fieldwardens keep the Moot safe from threats inside and outside.
Master Chefs are the greatest cooks in Halfling society, which might as well mean they are its high priests.
Halfling Sheriffs are both local militia leaders and law enforcement... most of their time.
Halfling commanders lead with hope in one hand and the promise of food in the other. It is surprisingly effective.
Esteemed figures in Halfling society, Fieldwardens keep the Moot safe from threats inside and outside.
Master Chefs are the greatest cooks in Halfling society, which might as well mean they are its high priests.
Halfling Sheriffs are both local militia leaders and law enforcement... most of their time.
Heroes
Protectors
Guardians
Only under the influence of a powerful warrior will the mighty ice trolls of Norsca accept armour pieces on their bodies.
Not unlike humans, trolls that live further away from the influence of chaos tend to be smaller and less impressive than their northern brethren.
The strongest, biggest and most ferocious angry ice trolls you could find. After countless battles, the frozen blood of their enemies on their bodies gave them their red hue.
Cavern Trolls are a subspecies of River Trolls who usually dwell in underground lakes and seas. They prey on the horrors of the deep and the occasional adventurer or Dwarf miner.

Whether these trolls were originally normal Stone Trolls or maybe another Troll species entirely is unknown, but their skin has been hardened to a point that they barely receive damage and rarely feel any pain. If they are hurt though, their confidence is shaken easily.
Living in the polluted of Marienburg's sewers near the sea, these Cavern Trolls learned how to smash ships for food.
There is only one troll in existence that can really be called a leader.  Luckily a mix of mind control and savage punishment can produce trolls that can at least create the illusion of leadership.
These Trolls got named by surviving Kislevite soldiers because they have often been seen together with the Trollking.
Trolls that have somewhat adapted to the forest life. They are difficult to spot in forests when standing still, but at the same time simply don't comprehend the concept of sneaking.
Bile Trolls are descendants of a troll horde that once defeated and devoured a Nurgle Army. Infected by the Plaguefather's many gifts, they suffer horribly for it.
Snow Trolls live on the highest peaks of mountains covered in eternal ice. They are of enormous size, dwelling in icy caves which are covered with the bones of their victims.
Born in the fallen Karak Azgal, chief Ugma is an unusually intelligent river troll leader. He himself suspects that his intellect increased through prolonged contact with warpstone.

Lava Trolls are an oddity, originally hailing from the Dark Lands. It is unknown if they are a testament of the incredible adaptability of trolls to every environment or the result of a twisted experiment by the sinister inhabitants of these accursed lands.

Rumored to be either creations of Chaos or escaped Moulder experiments, the Warped Ones are growing warpstone from their body, appearently without suffering ill effects from it. They are seemingly immune to pain and will only run near death.
The arabyan cities hide all kinds of dangers in their shadows. The assassins of this land are renowned for their skill, wiping out their targets in swift, stealthy attacks.
The Askar are warriors without equal, who are promoted for their worth, serving as bodyguards for most important leaders of Araby.
The Arabyan cities hide all kinds of dangers in their shadows. The assassins of this land are renowned for their skill, wiping out their targets in swift, stealthy attacks.

Rarely can the elusive Shugon - Trolls of the Sea - be lured to leave their deep sea habitats and venture on land. The enormous pressure of the deep sea give them monstrous strength, even compared to other trolls.
The existance of Troll champions can be seen as a proof for the humor of the dark gods or their cruelty. Or both.
Sometimes, rarely, a seemingly normal troll never stops to grow. Scholars still debate possible reasons, but it is probably connected to the volatile, chaotic nature of troll biology.
Undead corpses of long-past heroes and warlords.
Battle Rams have very thick woolly coats which makes them very hard to hurt. They also pack a powerful headbutt and have wicked horns.
The Sheep Dogs are usually found towards the rear of the Halfling's cavalry units. Sheep Dogs are notoriously loyal to their masters and will often lay down their lives for them.
With dreams of mountains of iced buns and rivers of fizzy-drink, they fearlessly entered Mordheim in search of gold, wyrdstone and abandoned kitchens to plunder.
Pantry Guards are Cooks with more than a reputation for their culinary skills. These elite fighters act as bodyguards for Halfling Chuck Wagons.
Lords of the Harvest are the leaders of gangs of farm labourers.
These tall, agile warriors live in the forests of Loren. They are quick on their feet, are not slowed by difficult terrain and are skilled in combat.
The Halflings have developed a crude catapult that hurls vats of boiling slosh into the enemy ranks with devastating effect.
Plaguebearers are the rank and file of Nurgle’s legions, crafted from the soul-stuff of mortals who have been slain.

Eusebio the Bleak leads a group of Flagellants, men who have been driven over the edge of sanity by some personal disaster or catastrophe, causing them to travel the Empire preaching their nightmare visions of doom.
